data_maturity_score.evidence: IBM enterprise environment with mix of legacy (Cognos, DataStage) and modern tools (Azure Data Factory, cloud platforms). Documented processes but traditional BI focus.

data_maturity_level.evidence: Score of 3 indicates documented processes and modern tools, but heavy reliance on traditional BI stack suggests defined rather than optimizing maturity

maturity_signals.evidence: Multiple cloud platforms mentioned (AWS, Google, Azure) and modern ETL tools (Azure Data Factory) alongside traditional tools

scope_creep_score.evidence: Focused BI engineer role with clear responsibilities around reporting, visualization, and ETL. No mention of data science, ML, or DevOps responsibilities

overtime_risk_score.evidence: Consulting role with client delivery focus suggests potential for long hours during project delivery, but no explicit overtime mentions

role_clarity.evidence: Well-defined BI engineer role with specific responsibilities: analysis, requirements, design, testing, support of reports in client environments

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Moderate risk - consulting environment may have demanding timelines, but role is well-defined and at stable enterprise company

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: No specific reporting structure mentioned - only mentions working with business and technical team members in client environments

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No manager level or reporting structure mentioned in job posting

team_growth_velocity.evidence: No information about team growth or expansion plans mentioned

team_composition.evidence: No specific team composition information provided - consulting delivery center model suggests variable team structures

reporting_structure.evidence: No reporting structure mentioned in job description

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: Consulting role involves working with business and technical members of client teams, suggesting cross-functional collaboration

work_life_balance_score.evidence: No work-life balance benefits mentioned. Consulting delivery roles often have demanding client timelines and potential for overtime

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: No learning budget, career growth, or advancement opportunities mentioned. Focus is on client delivery rather than internal development

tech_culture_score.evidence: Traditional enterprise environment with legacy BI tools (Cognos) mixed with modern cloud platforms. No mention of modern engineering practices

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No tech culture indicators mentioned - no open source, conferences, hackathons, or innovation time

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: No development practices mentioned - no code review, CI/CD, testing, or monitoring practices discussed

innovation_signals.evidence: Focus on maintaining and supporting existing reporting systems rather than innovation or new technology adoption

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: No mention of modernizing systems, reducing tech debt, or improving code quality

ai_integration_level.evidence: No AI or ML mentioned in job description - focus is entirely on traditional BI, reporting, and ETL

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No ML tools mentioned - role focused on traditional BI stack with Cognos and ETL tools

hiring_urgency.evidence: No urgent timeline mentioned - standard consulting hiring process implied

competition_level.evidence: IBM brand attracts candidates, but location in Pune and specific Cognos requirements may limit applicant pool

company_stage_inferred.evidence: IBM is a large, established enterprise company with global consulting operations

hiring_velocity.evidence: IBM Consulting likely has regular hiring needs for delivery centers, but no aggressive expansion signals

team_size_signals.evidence: No specific team size mentioned - consulting delivery centers have variable team structures

funding_stage_signals.evidence: IBM is a publicly traded, established enterprise company

role_creation_type.evidence: Consulting delivery centers typically expand teams based on client demand and project pipeline

strength_details: IBM brand provides stability and enterprise experience
Exposure to multiple cloud platforms (AWS, Google, Azure)
Mix of traditional and modern ETL tools for diverse experience
concern_details: No salary information provided - typical for consulting roles
No visa sponsorship mentioned - requires existing work authorization in India
No career growth or learning opportunities mentioned
Heavy focus on legacy BI tools (Cognos) may limit modern data engineering skills
best_fit_details: Mid-level engineers (3-5 years) with BI/DW experience
Candidates with Cognos experience seeking stable enterprise environment
probe_details: Ask about salary range and compensation structure
Understand career progression opportunities within IBM Consulting
Clarify types of client projects and industries served
Discuss any travel requirements for client engagements
leverage_details: Strong Cognos Developer & Admin skills are specific and valuable
Previous consulting or client-facing experience is valuable for delivery roles
summary.overall_assessment: Stable enterprise BI engineering role at IBM with exposure to multiple cloud platforms and ETL tools. Good for candidates seeking traditional BI experience at a established company. Main limitations are lack of growth opportunities, salary transparency, and heavy focus on legacy technologies.
